name: Basilica Papale di Santa Maria Maggiore
Piazza Bologna
Piazza del Popolo
Roman Dinner Filled with Wine
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Massimo welcomes you for a dinner in his home in the beautiful Roman neighborhood of Monteverde. You’ll experience Massimo’s excellent hospitality as you are served an incredible 4-course dinner, complete with Roman specialties. Sip away on complementary Prosecco, digestifs and excellent Italian wines and really get to know your host as Massimo shares his passion for cooking with you!

name: Catacombs Tour and Ancient Roman Lunch
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Join Fiamma and Debora for an immersive ancient Rome experience! You will start off with a traditional Italian breakfast (cappuccino and croissant), followed by a tour of the Catacombs and then sit down for a delicious ancient Roman lunch!

name: Catacombs of St. Callixtus
When in Rome: Daniela's Walking Dessert Tour
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Join Daniela and her team for a walk around the sweeter side of Rome. Try the best coffee, tiramisu and gelato Rome has to offer, whilst taking in the beautiful Roman architecture. Your tour guide will also talk to you about the cultural and gastronomical history of Rome. There's more to Italy than pasta!

name: Morning Roman market tour and evening dinner party
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Start your morning off with a tour of a Roman food market, then come back to the hosts' place in the evening for a mouthwatering dinner with wine. • 3 traditional Italian courses • Red wine is included • Communal dining for up to 19 people About your host, Federica & Barbara: "In our house you will find the sensitivity for receiving guests and a great love for art and culture. Our friends think that we're extraordinarily hospitable! The tasting of excellent Italian wines makes for a fantastic experience where you'll discover the secrets of the precious Roman cuisine." *** PLEASE NOTE: Morning meeting point will be at 11.30 am at Campo de' Fiori market. We will meet again at 8 pm for dinner at my apartment in the heart of Trastevere neighborhood!

name: “ THANKSGIVING IN ROME”.
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

After having spent some Thanksgiving in the US, I was so fascinated by the origin of this tradition and the extraordinary menu, that I decided to propose one for my guests in Rome! I will cook the most traditional dishes, to which I will add a touch of Italian cuisine.

name: Cook On A Roman Rooftop: Three Delicious Courses And Views Of Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Phoebe invites you out onto her terrace to look out across the beautiful city of Rome! But you haven’t just come for the views, you’re also here for a fantastic three-course Italian cooking class! You’ll be welcomed with a glass of prosecco or a delicious fruit juice and enjoy complimentary wine throughout your lunch. Phoebe has a selection of brilliant dishes for you to choose from and learn, from osso bucco to chicken cacciatore, so you’ll leave her experience full and with the knowledge of a local!

name: Enjoy a Designer Dinner Next to The Beautiful Castel Sant’Angelo
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Dine on quintessential Italian cuisine paired with delicious wines and digestifs chosen by your host, Phoebe. Phoebe is a brilliant visual artist, whose skills carry into her talent for creating beautiful plates of food. She will serve dishes including freshly made pasta, osso uco, chicken marsala and cooks with seasonal and local produce. Your meal will be served on her terrrace, which boasts an an incredible view of the Castel Sant’Angelo!

name: Traditional Roman Cooking Class with a Sunset View in the Old Jewish Quarter
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Head to the restaurant and meet the Chef ready for you to reveal secrets and recipes. This is a hands-on class, but if you’d just like to be a spectator you can relax, watching the chef working, with a glass of wine. You’ll learn to make home-made pasta from scratch, cleaning and preparing seasonal vegetables to fry and tasting dessert that all roman grandmas used to cook for local kids. Let’s put our hands in the dough. Start your cooking class learning how to make fresh pasta from scratch. Using our grandma's style you will be able to make it again when back home. Seasonal food is a must in Rome, in the winter class, you’ll have the opportunity to learn how to peel artichokes to be cooked at the Jewish Style, one of the highlights of Roman cuisine. In the Summer’s class, you’ll learn how to prepare zucchini flowers or any other amazing fresh vegetable to make the original “fritto romano”. In the end taste the amazing torta di ricotta e visciola, the famous ricotta cheesecake made with simple and delicious ingredients.

name: Farmers' market shopping and picnic
description: We're gonna experience shopping in an Italian farmers'market. We'll meet the producers and buy the best seasonal products for our picnic. It will be possible to buy drinks too: soft drinks, beer and wine. Then we'll head to one of the most beautiful spots in Rome to have a picnic with all the amazing products from the market🧺

name: Restaurant Ai Spaghettari
The Art of Fettuccini cooking class and dinner in Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Become a chef for an evening while you prepare pasta from scratch while learning all about the different types of pasta from the North to the South of Italy. • Prepare fettuccini, tonnarelli, spaghetti, pappardelle, ravioli and tortellini from scratch, as well as four sauces. Nibble on antipasto while you work, then enjoy your creations for dinner, followed by dessert • Cocktails and wine are included • In a penthouse in the historical district of Testaccio • Communal cooking class and dining for 2 to 6 people • Andrea is an engineer About your host, Andrea: I spent my whole life traveling around the world. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing good meals with them.

name: Enjoy a Pasta Making Day in an Elegant Apartment!
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Join your experienced host for a pasta making class meant to nourish the soul and the psychophysical well-being of her guests. Your host currently organizes and teaches numerous cooking courses at the Stenerian School 'Janua' of Rome. Having managed for more than 35 years the bistro 'Creperie of Testaccio', a well-known bistro/restaurant specialised in crepes and galettes, she gained a great knowledge of international cuisine, the ancient Roman cuisine and of the vegan and vegetarian cuisine. She has always mantained a great interest in the recovery of the traditional Italian peasant recipies, in the value of cuisine as a means for nourishing the soul and the psychophysical well-being of her guests. For this purpose, in her career, she has prioritized the use of quality and genuine raw materials, with a particular focus in the 'seasonability' and the 'emotional value' of food.

name: Nutrition with the 5 Senses
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Dine in the kitchen of a health studio the heart of Rome, with an incredible view overlooking the Tiber river. Run by Jonathan & Teresa, expect to try their homemade Kombucha, taste their biological wine and pasta 'del senatore', which is completely organic and produced in small quantities by private farmers. Join this exciting and informative tasting session experience curated by their in-house nutritionist. Expect to be using all five of your senses.

name: Walk Your Way Around Rome and Eat Your Fill of The City
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Taste your way through the streets of Rome as you Daniela and her team guide you through the best shops, restaurants and markets that this ancient city has to offer. You’ll try everything from focaccia to gelato and, as a sommelier, you can trust Daniela to give you only the best wines during your tour! Her expertise on local food and wine will fill you up and provide you with enough knowledge to navigate Rome’s offerings yourself.

name: Fresh pasta making class and dinner by the Tiber river
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Have fun preparing fresh egg pasta using the best flour and the best techniques that host Pigi has mastered over the years, before enjoying your creations for dinner. • You can choose from the following pasta: pappardelle, tagliolini, fettuccine, reginette, maltagliati, gnocchi, ricotta and spinach ravioli, that you'll both prepare from scratch and enjoy! • Aperitif and a glass of wine are included • In a beautiful Roman penthouse, close to the Tiber river • Communal cooking class and dining for 2 to 6 people • Pigi has taken professional cooking classes About your host, Pigi: "I'm a lover of quality food and my mom used to run a restaurant in Lago del Santo, in Rieti. She was my teacher and taught me a lot about fresh products, combinations, and cooking. I'm always looking for the best products, preferably organic and farm-to-table!"

name: Fiumi Fountain
Street food and pizza tour in Monti
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Discover the best Roman pizza and street food in a 2.5-hour off-the-beaten-track tour near the Colosseum. You'll sample a variety of traditional and street food, including over 10 different types of pizza! At every stop, your tour guide will tell you the history behind the dishes you try and beer will be provided. This is a dynamic and tasty way to explore Rome!

name: Handmade pasta class and dinner in Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Spend the morning learning how to make fresh fettuccine with tomato and basil sauce or ravioli (stuffed pasta with ricotta and spinach) with sage and butter sauce. • After the class, sit down to enjoy your pasta along with a mixed salad and a seasonal dessert • Wine is included, guests can also BYOB • Class and communal lunch for 2 to 6 people • Over 60 rave reviews on TripAdvisor About your host, Giovanna E Cristina: "We are Giovanna and Cristina, 2 best friends who love to share our passion for cooking. Inspired by traditional Italian recipes passed down by our families, we believe that simple, local food is the best food. Like many Italians, we know that a good meal is made better with wine!"

name: Italian Wine Workshop with Sicilian Organic Wine Makers
description:
Join organic Sicilian winemakers Valentina and Giuseppe to learn all about organic wine, Sicilian grapes and the wine-making process. The experience will be live streamed from their Sicilian winery.
You will make fantastic wine cocktails and learn about casero vermouth (an aromatized fortified wine flavoured with various ingredients eg. roots, barks, flowers, seeds, herbs, and spices).

name: Dinner by the Spanish Steps
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Barbara for a traditional Italian dinner with a relaxed atmosphere in a beautiful Roman home that will immerse you in the charm of the Spanish Steps! • Dine on numerous antipasti, two first courses, a second course, two side dishes, and a dessert • Aperitif, beer, wine, spirits, and digestif are included • In an 18th century home, just a stone's throw away from the famous Spanish Steps in Rome • Communal dining for 4 to 16 people • Barbara has rave reviews on TripAdvisor! About your host, Barbara: "We find cooking relaxing, and we love experimenting with new flavors and blending traditional Italian cuisine with inspiration from our many travels. Adding that particular touch to classic dishes is our speciality! It's not only the food itself that fascinates us, but we also love presenting it creatively."

name: Piazza di Spagna
Master The Art of Gelato and Tiramisu
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Want to learn the secrets to making Italian gelato and traditional tiramisù? Look no further. Come and learn how to make the authentic and organic tiramisu from a professional pastry-chef in Rome city centre. You'll start from scratch (ie., baking your biscuits) to the very end and final touches. Your host will explain the importance of choosing quality ingredients with an eye to freshness and organically produced food. You'll also learn how to make water based gelato (Italian artisan sorbet) with fresh and seasonal fruit. At the end of the lesson you’ll samples different versions for Tiramisu, including your one!

name: Piazza Navona
Dine on a Roman terrace with family recipes
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Discover Rocco and Fabio's traditional family recipes at this dinner on their cozy Roman terrace. Choose your menu beforehand, then sit back and enjoy the beautiful setting! About your host, Rocco & Fabio: "We are a couple, Rocco and Fabio. We live in Rome in a very nice area close to the magnificent park Caffarella/Appia Antica. Our passion is cooking. We love hosting people and sharing our family recipes and stories with them!"

name: "COOKING WITH LOVE" Cooking Class
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Learn how to make a traditional Italian dinner with chef Michela, then sit down to enjoy the delicious fresh pasta and tiramisu you cooked together! Join the host at her beautiful house in the Trastevere area, in the heart of Rome. About your host Michela: "Best Rome's home restaurant" according to star chef celebrity Alessandro Borghese, Italian TV Show "4 Ristoranti"

name: Typical Italian dinner with a Roman family
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Andrea and his wife at their home in Rome for a delicious Italian dinner that will make you feel like a member of their family! • 3-course Italian dinner in a family atmosphere • Wine is included • Easily accessible by public transportation • Communal dining for 2 to 6 people • Andrea is an engineer and hosts with his wife About your host, Andrea: "I spent my whole life traveling around the world. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing good meals with them."

name: Amatriciana  & Tiramisù Cooking Class and Dinner in Monteverde
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Start the cooking class by preparing Tiramisu, followed by pasta from scratch with Amatriciana sauce. Enjoy nibbles while you cook, then sit down for dinner with a view! • Snack on welcome Bruschetta during the class, then sit down to enjoy your pasta for dinner • Wine is included • Massimo's home is in Monteverde Vecchio, just a few minutes from Trastevere and the historic center • Communal cooking class and dining for up to 12 people • Massimo has a wonderful sense of hospitality and a great love for Italian food About your host, Massimo: "I'll host you in our stunning house near the Gianicolo hill, a unique location in a famous and historic neighborhood, with breathtaking views of Rome. My large and elegant living room is perfect for social eating."

name: Jet Surfing near Rome
description:
The impossible is now possible! Experience the thrill of surfing without any wind or waves by trying this up-and-coming extreme sport that’s taking over the surfing world.

Jet surfing is a new, action-packed watersport that uses a motorized surfboard in order to carve the water whether you’re in an ocean, lake, or inland waterways! Flat surfaces won’t be able to stop you from having an epic surf session and nearly anyone can jet surf since it’s easy to learn and no prior surfing experience is necessary.

Professional instructors will make sure you’ll learn the skills needed in order to ride with ease. If you choose to ride with the Jetsurf Adventure DFI 2019,  you’ll also be given waterproof walkie-talkies so that the instructor can give you advice any time. Choose from two models:

- eSurf S1 board (8 years old and up): This board is easy to control since you’ll be able to switch the speed and stop the board with a simple click of a button on the wireless controller. You will get to reach a maximum speed of 26 km/h for up to 20 minutes.

- Jetsurf Adventure DFI 2019 (14 years old and up): This is the ideal model for adrenaline junkies since you will get to reach a speed of 55 km/h. Whether you are a beginner or experienced rider, you will get to ride with ease since the jet surfboard has three fins, giving more support for difficult maneuvers.

For your next holiday, feel the excitement of trying this new extreme watersport with the only company in Italy where you can rent jet surfboards!

name: All Roads Lead To Rome For This Fantastic Four-Course Feast
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Stefano in his native city of Rome for a delightful four-course dinner that encompasses the very best of Italian cuisine -plus a few fun additions from his time spent in kitchens around the world! From caprese salad, to homemade carbonara, saltimbocca and panacotta, you will try the some of the most traditional and delicious Italian dishes. Stefano will also serve wine, digestifs and cocktails to accompany your meal, but you are also welcome to BYOB.

name: Sof Urban Rafting in the Heart of Rome
description:
Get a fresh perspective of one of the most famous cosmopolitan cities in the world as you paddle your way across the stunning Tiber River in the heart of Rome!

to travel far for this outdoor adventure. You’ll meet your expert guide in Piazza del Popolo where they will accompany you to the starting point of your trip on the famous Tiber River, telling you some fun facts about Rome along the way!

Once reaching the Ponte Regina Margherita (approx. 20 minutes), your guide will provide a detailed safety briefing where you’ll also get to gear up and learn some basic paddling techniques and commands. You’ll be provided with further explanation about what to expect once you’re on the raft.

The descent starts off peaceful as you glide across the river away from the hustle and bustle of Rome.  You’ll truly get to immerse yourself in tranquil surroundings without even stepping away from the city! As you continue down, you’ll have incredible views of Castel Sant'Angelo from your unique perspective on the river. You’ll even get to take a quick rest where you’ll have the opportunity to take photos!

After, you’ll continue along the river before docking at the famous Isola Tiberina, the only island on the Tiber River that runs through Rome. You’ll have the unique chance to visit one of the world's smallest inhabited islands before continuing your navigation and facing the rapids below the legendary bridge of the island.

Your rafting trip ends at Trastevere, the famous Roman district that’s the perfect blend between ancient and modern times—just like your adventure! You’ll get to explore its streets where you’ll even have the chance to try typical street food in Rome.

From crossing under ancient Roman bridges to playing on the tricky rapids of the river, you don’t want to miss out on this exhilarating rafting trip that offers a unique point of view of Rome!

name: Make and Cook Pasta like a Pro!
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Food is an invaluable and delicious way to learn about a country’s culture and history, especially Italy’s! Join us at our home, a brisk 10 minute walk from the Vatican Museums for a fun-filled and immersive cooking lesson and social dining experience that will teach you how to expertly prepare pasta from scratch and one of Italy’s many desserts, most notably, the classic tiramisù. Other dessert options are also available! For dietary specifications, please do not hesitate to enquire directly with us as we cater to a wide variety of diets.

name: Roman Style Fresh Pasta and Tiramisu Cooking Class
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Learn to cook Italian classics then enjoy your creations in a cozy restaurant or on the outdoor terrace. Savor Roman wine and learn all of the chef's tips and tricks!

name: Vatican market food tour and shopping (early morning)
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Trionfale market is one of the oldest Roman food markets with over 273 stalls. Together we will meet the best marketers and stallers inside with all of their history and traditional products. • There are approximately 7 stops tasting; we will eat pizza with mortadella, supplì, orange coppa, olives, Porchetta di Ariccia, Pecorino Cheese, dried fruit and toasted almonds, season fruits, the best oil in Lazio region • Wine, coffee or cappuccino and water are included • Food walk for up to 10 people About your host, Sabrina: "I was born in Rome and have always loved my city. I am lucky to live close to the Trionfale market and would be delighted to have you experience a typical Roman outing to this magical market and to show you all its' hidden secrets."

name: Modern Italian dinner near the Vatican
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Chef Debora for a culinary journey and wine pairing, through the different regions of Italy. Take a seat at her table and enjoy a refined 4-course menu prepared with fresh ingredients from the farmers' market!

name: Vatican market food tour and shopping (late morning)
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Trionfale market is one of the oldest Roman food markets with over 273 stalls. Together we will meet the best marketers and stallers inside with all of their history and traditional products. • There are approximately 7 stops tasting; we will eat pizza with mortadella, supplì, orange coppa, olives, Porchetta di Ariccia, Pecorino Cheese, dried fruit and toasted almonds, season fruits, the best oil in Lazio region • Wine, coffee or cappuccino and water are included • Food walk for up to 10 people About your host, Sabrina: "I was born in Rome and have always loved my city. I am lucky to live close to the Trionfale market and would be delighted to have you experience a typical Roman outing to this magical market and to show you all its' hidden secrets."

name: Celebrate Carnival of Viareggio - virtual masterclass
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

The Carnival of Viareggio is one of the most important events in Italy. Join host Sandra for a virtual Carnival of Viareggio celebration! She will teach you how to make two classic carnival dishes - tordello (raviolo) or stuffed cabbage leaves served with a tomato sauce and chiacchere (sweet fried cookies).

name: Bike / E-Bike City Center Tour in Rome
description:
Bike / E-Bike City Center Tour in Rome. Enjoy this magnificent city by bike with your family, friends or couple.

This is the perfect time to hop on a bike: this tour on an electric bike combines the must-see attractions of Rome along with less known sights. This tour offers an interesting and original way to enjoy the Eternal City at its best.

Your private tour guide will share everything about the stories and interesting facts about what made Rome the greatest Empire of the world. The tour will encompass the most famous sites of the city: you will be able to get through ancient monuments like the Colosseum, admire the elegant shopping streets, experience lively squares such as Piazza Navona, and gaze at stunning churches.

Moreover, you can explore even the most hidden and less touristy corners to have a one of a kind experience.

name: Ravioli & Dessert Cooking Class
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Fancy the idea of having a cooking class in the comfort of your B&B or holiday home during your stay in Rome? Look no further. I offer small-group cooking classes where you’ll learn tips and knowledge on how to recreate fail-proof gnocchi, time after time. We will also be making a dessert together of your choice. The classes will culminate in a sit down meal. For group bookings, I offer a rented kitchen/dining space in the Prati neighbourhood, near the Vatican. Please enquire with me in advance for availability. For your sauce, please select 1 from the following: 1) al sole - ricotta filling with a lemon butter sauce OR 2) ravioli alla crema di piselli in salsa di noce e formaggio - ravioli with peas and mint filling in a cheese and walnut sauce (vegetarian) OR 3) ricotta e spinaci con burro e salvia - ravioli with ricotta and spinach filling, sautéed in butter and sage (vegetarian) OR 4) al ragu -ravioli in a meat sauce OR 5) melanzane e ricotta con confit di datterini - eggplant and ricotta filling with a caramelised cherry tomato sauce OR 6) pesce e ricotta con salsa ai porri, limone e menta - fish and ricotta filling with leek, lemon and mint sauce For dessert, please select 1 of the following: 1) Tiramisù classico - the classic tiramisu recipe with pasteurized eggs, mascarpone, sugar, coffee and cocoa OR 2) Tiramisù al limone - savoiardi, limoncello syrup, lemon-mascarpone cream (contains eggs) OR 3) Torta "Black Magic" - olive oil, red wine and dark chocolate baked dessert. Tastes like a dream, between a cake and a mousse. OR 4) Fantasia di Caffè - chilled layered dessert containing crushed amaretti cookies, coffee and ricotta cream, topped with dark chocolate and olive oil sauce (eggless) OR 5) *winter special: Dolce al vin brulè - chilled, layered dessert of crushed amaretti cookies aromatized with rosemary, sweetened ricotta and topped with chopped pear poached in red wine and spices Dessert is served in individual portions. The event generally lasts 3-3.5 hours. I can start anytime from 09:30-19:00. Please enquire with me directly with your preferred timing. Please let me know in advance if you have any dietary requests/specifications.

name: Traditional Roman dinner made with Nonna's recipes
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

This dinner is an ode to traditional Roman food. In a cozy, welcoming home, you'll feast on authentic dishes that have been passed down from the hosts' grandmother. Traditional Roman aperitivo, 3 courses and a side dish, made using their grandmother's recipes and secrets. Janice and Francesca are sisters with a passion for cooking and social eating. Their grandmother Marcella managed a restaurant in Trastevere for many years and handed down her passion for food. *NOTE: TO REACH US: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: https://viaggiacon.atac.roma.it/ APP FOR THE TAXI: https://www.ittaxi.it/app WE CAN ORGANIZE PRIVATE TRANSFER WITH A PARTNER COMPANY (DIRECT PAYMENTO TO THE DRIVER) with the following rates: from Rome center, cost for one way 1-4 pax € 35.00, 5-8 pax € 45.00. For the return the same cost. If the transfer is between 22.00 and 06.00 plus 10% for the night plus 10% for public holiday (like Sunday). Plus 10% to be paid by card and / or invoice.

name: 1 hour Morning pizza class in Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

This pizza crash course with a chef is the perfect way to familiarize yourself with the Italian pizza tradition, and to enjoy your creations along with a glass of wine. • Prepare and enjoy some of the great classics of Italian pizza, from classic Margherita to Focaccia, as well as tomato Bruschetta cooked in a wood oven and homemade Cacio e Pepe chips • One drink is included • In a cozy restaurant with an outdoor terrace • Communal cooking class for 2 to 12 people • Davide is a professional chef About your host, Jacqueline: I want my guests to have a multisensory journey to discover the most incredible flavors from my country. I believe in culture in its many different facets, the beauty of diversity. Hence my passion for communication, travel, and food, elements that blend with my goal of bridging different cultures.

name: Natural-dyed handmade pasta class
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

This is the class for you if you’re interested to learn how to colour your pasta dough with all-natural ingredients! My dyes are vegetable-based purées or powders that are 100% food-grade safe, homemade and best of all, replicable on your own when you return home! You will learn to make a classic pasta dough and 3 coloured doughs, after which we will make 2 sauces to eat them with. We will also get to assemble a dessert of your choice. Finally, we will sit down and enjoy the fruits of our labour with wine. Non-alcoholic beverages are also available on request. The options for all the dishes will be sent to you once you make your booking. I am pretty flexible with dietary preferences and cater to a wide range. A sample menu looks like this: Appetisers: Zucchini and Parmesan fritters with a seasonal sauce (eg. In the summer it could be a datterini tomato and rosemary compote), bruschette with fresh seasonal toppings (I usually go to the fresh market the day before or a couple hours earlier before the class commences to get inspired and make my selections!) Main courses: Beetroot and spinach dough pasta paired with a stracciatella and walnut sauce + classic and cacao dough pasta paired with a tomato and meat ragù Dessert: Tiramisù OR a ricotta and sour cherry tart OR a seasonal item

name: Make Ravioli  & Panna Cotta with an Italian Chef
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Join Sandra for an interactive online masterclass. You will learn how to make traditional Ravioli from scratch with a fresh seasonal sauce, followed by one of Italy's most famous desserts - Panna Cotta with fresh fruit syrup. When the class is over, sit down at your dining table and enjoy!

name: Taste authentic family cuisine in upscale setting
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join us for a 5-course dinner in our apartment, which it's a representation of great Italian architecture! All the ingredients come from our family farm and we are professionally trained chefs. During the warm summer months, we serve dinner on our cozy terrace. Have a look at the menu and choose one dish among the pasta courses and the main courses. About your host: Winner of the TV show “ Cortesie per gli ospiti ” for the best hospitality, food, and location.

name: Italia Calling: Virtual Cooking Class Live from Tuscany
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Cook authentic Italian recipes live from Tuscany with your host Sandra who will demonstrate the dishes step by step, including personalized cooking tips. Having lived in Tuscany, Milan and Rome, Sandra has an extensive knowledge of Italy’s varied dishes which she is keen to share with you in her virtual cooking experience. Perfect for various different groups, be sure to soak up all the knowledge Sandra has to offer and then sit down to enjoy the fruits of your labor!

name: Unique Roman food walk and tastings with archeologists
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Discover more than 20 types of local food at the best, hidden spots around Rome during this unique food walk that's filled with historical and archeological secrets. • Enjoy more than 20 food and wine tastings including cornetto, mozzarella, prosciutto, aged cheeses, Suppli, olive oil, pizza, pasta, Tiramisu, and gelato in the Pope's favorite place, and you'll even get to make your own bruschetta! • Become a coffee expert in a local bar, then enjoy local wine in an Apulian street food shop • You'll explore the best hidden food gems on foot, as well as the biggest Roman market • Communal food walk for up to 12 people • The tastings will be 'seasoned' with storytelling about Rome, its history and archeological secrets About your host, Selene: "I'm Selene, a Roman for generations and the co-founder of 'Roma Eat Food Experience'. We're archeologists, official guides, food and wine experts, but mostly, we're great friends. Our mantra is to be the people we would love to meet when traveling: passionate, positive, curious, and engaging!"

name: Savour The Taste Of Puglia
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Since Matteo’s paternal family is Pugliese, we give to those in Rome who may not get the chance to travel to the heel of the "boot", a chance to dine with us as we cook some of our favourite Pugliese dishes. We like to add our own modern touch to traditional specialties using ingredients bought during our stays in Puglia; homemade puccie bread paired with jams for antipasti, homemade cinnamon taralli with dark chocolate dip for dessert…served with Negroamaro wine bought directly from the cantina. Antipasti - Homemade mini puccie (olive and spicy kinds) with tomato and onion jams Primi (First course): Orecchiette con cime di rape - a typical pugliese pasta dish with broccoli rabe AND Riso con patate e cozze - Carnaroli rice with potatoes and mussels, ovenbaked Dolci (desserts): Taralli alla canella con cioccolato fondente fuso - our cheeky take on churros, using artisanal cinnamon taralli bought during our recent trip in Puglia, served with our own dark chocolate dip AND Mini pasticciotti - A dessert from Galatina, little tarts of toothsome shortcrust pastry encasing vanilla custard and cherry compote.

name: Conquer A Seven-course Dinner Like Caesar
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Tackle this amazing seafood feast during Pigi's seven-course meal. Your meal will include several delicious Roman wines and liqueurs to enjoy as you spend your evening on top of a beautiful Roman penthouse, overlooking the river Tiber. Pigi is as generous with the food as he is talented, so expect to be thoroughly stuffed by the time you’re finished! Are you ready to conquer?

name: Italian Wine Tasting and Food Pairing Workshop
description:
Discover the best Italian wines during this wine tasting, with chef and host, Deborah and professional sommelier, Luca! 

Together they will guide you through the evening, whilst you discover the best Italian wines. The wines will be paired with delicious fresh bread and an amazing selection of extra virgin olive oil, artisan cheeses as well as fresh vegetables from your hosts’ own back garden! This intimate experience gives you a great combination of amazing wine and high quality products, whilst starting you on your journey of becoming a wine tasting expert!

name: Roam Around The Roman Market
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Michaela is here to be your guide around the wonderful local markets of her neighbourhood in Rome. You can expect to try typical Italian street food dishes like suppli, porchetta, copious amounts of cheese and delicious white pizza (a variation of the popular dish without tomato sauce!). No trip to an Italian market would ever be complete without wine, so expect plenty of options from local sellers and take Michela's advice seriously when she tells you which you have to try! This is where Michela gets her groceries every day after all!

name: Cook a Classic Italian Meal Inspired by a Roman Grandmother
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Try Janice and Francesca’s real Italian cooking which tastes just like Grandma’s. Receive instruction from two very welcoming and generous Italian sisters as they share their Nonna's special recipe for gnocchi, in a deliciously rich and creamy tomato sauce. After you’re done cooking, relax and enjoy a wonderful dinner in Rome, along with your newfound Italian friends.

name: Fettuccine, ravioli, and gnocchi cooking class and dinner
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

In this cooking class, you'll learn how to make fettuccine, spinach and ricotta ravioli, and gnocchi from scratch, that you'll then enjoy for dinner with your host. • Learn how to make handmade pasta that will be topped with Ragout for the gnocchi, Gricia for the ravioli, and sauce with mushrooms and Pachino for the fettuccine, and enjoy your creations for dinner (as well as a few snacks while you cook!) • Wine and digestif are included • The home is very close to the 'Riserva naturale dell'Insugherata' • Communal cooking class and dining for up to 8 people • Sara was born in Rome and has lived there her whole life! Her specialty is her grandmother's recipe for homemade pasta About your host, Sara: "My passion for cooking started as a child when my mother came home late from work and prepared Minestrina with cheese, cooked ham and puree...As soon as I could use the stove, I started to try recipes and I learned to cook, and from then my passion was born."

name: 1 hour Afternoon pizza class in Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

This pizza crash course with a chef is the perfect way to familiarize yourself with the Italian pizza tradition, and to enjoy your creations along with a glass of wine. • Prepare and enjoy some of the great classics of Italian pizza, from classic Margherita to Focaccia, as well as tomato Bruschetta cooked in a wood oven and homemade Cacio e Pepe chips • One drink is included • In a cozy restaurant with an outdoor terrace • Communal cooking class for 2 to 12 people About your host, Jacqueline: I want my guests to have a multisensory journey to discover the most incredible flavors from my country. I believe in culture in its many different facets, the beauty of diversity. Hence my passion for communication, travel, and food, elements that blend with my goal of bridging different cultures.

name: Enjoy an Authentic Ancient Roman Dinner!
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Having managed for more than 35 years the bistro “Creperie of Testaccio”, a well-known bistro/restaurant specialised in crepes and galettes, I gained a great knowledge of international cuisine, the ancient Roman cuisine and of the vegan and vegetarian cuisine. I always mantained a great interest in the recovery of the traditional Mediterranean recipies, in the value of cuisine as a means for nourishing the soul and the psychophysical well-being of my guests. For this reason in my career, I have prioritized the “seasonability” and the “emotional value “of food. The ancient Roman dinner will be held in an elegant apartment located just a few steps from the Colosseum following the ancient Roman receips of Marcus Gavius Apicius, gastronome, cook and Roman writer who lived at the turn of the first and second century A.D. He wrote the oldest Roman cookery receips book “ The res coquinaria” . In the res coquinaria are described dishes that served to make the banquests of Roman nobles and aristocrats unique and special for showing their power and magnificence on the other foreign guests. During the ancient Roman dinner will be described dishes and the ancient Roman techniques of their preparation. Will follow the reading of the classic texts of the ancient Roman cuisine such as the famed the dinner of “Trimalchone” narrated in the Satyricon of Petronio and the famous lustful Lucullian dinner narrated by Plutarch interpreted by our expert archaeology lecturer Claudia Pinci accompained by the sound of the traditional ancient roman music .

name: Let’s toast, Drink & Explore Hidden Corners after the Sunset
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Would you like to avoid tourist traps, discover the city with an archaeologist and have fun at the sunset, or after it? Are you curious to know what Romans really do (and drink) for the aperitif or after dinner (spoiler: the spritz is NOT a typical Roman beverage)? That you are a couple, a group, a family or a solo traveler, this is the experience for you. In 2 hours, guided by an archaeologist with great knowledge of food & wine, we will enjoy different tastings and a pleasant walk in the oldest district of Rome: Rione Monti. Just a few steps away from the Colosseum, this place is a hidden gem completely off the beaten path. We will drink in a little bar that hides a “secret” inside, eat a typical Roman street food and chat with the glass in one hand while walking at the discovery of hidden corners of Rome. In details, we will taste a beer, a glass of wine and a “secret” drink invented in Italy that few know about. All in unique locations and with personalized story telling. The experience is scheduled at two different times, perfect for those who want to enjoy an aperitif before dinner, as well for those who want to “digest” with a pleasant walk. In both cases consider that this experience will not substitute dinner. SPECIAL: We also organize private experiences on request. Write us for more info. • Take a time machine and discover amazing historical details around Rome, talking about daily life over 2000 years of history • Communal drink walk for up to 12 people • The guides are archeologists so they'll tell you all about the history of the city About your host, Selene: "I'm Selene, a Roman for generations and the co-founder of 'Roma Eat Food Experience'. We're archeologists, official guides, food and wine experts, but mostly, we're great friends. Our mantra is to be the people we would love to meet when traveling: passionate, positive, curious, and engaging!"

name: Rome Aperitivo and Street Food Tour
description:
This Rome Street Food & Aperitivo Tour will take you off the beaten track and introduce you to the love affair that Romans have with street food, beer and wine

As you walk through the city, you will pass the famous Pantheon and Piazza Navona and eat at historical boutique, contemporary eateries, breweries and chic cocktail bars.
Get a taste of a true Italian Aperitivo in addition to local pizza, cheese, wine and ice cream or tiramisu!

name: Rome Trastevere Food Tour
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Looking for some good food in Trastevere? Look no further. This Trastevere Food Tour takes place in the historic Trastevere area and will guide you through the most popular Roman dishes, their unique flavours and famous wines from Lazio. At each stop and restaurant you'll try something new such as Roman cheeses with sun dried tomatoes, the traditional rice supplì, Roman pizza or the famous Prosciutto di Norcia with bufalo mozzarella cheese and a dish of the famous pasta alla carbonara. You'll finish the tour with one of the best gelatos in the area!

name: Testaccio market tour and lunch
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Tour the historic Testaccio food market and select the ingredients for a delicious lunch. Then head back to Andrea's home with a view of Piramide to enjoy your meal together. • Tour the market and then sit down for a 4-course Italian lunch • Wine is included • Visit the historical center of the Roman food empire while exploring the Testaccio market. Lunch takes place in a penthouse with a view • Communal food walk and dining for 2 to 4 people • Andrea is an engineer About your host, Andrea: I spent my whole life traveling around the world. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing good meals with them.

name: Roman Street Art Tour and Lunch with an architect in his home
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Discover beautiful Roman street art in the historic suburbs and enjoy an open-air museum, followed by lunch at ...my place....!! Of course, with excellent pasta and wine. The area of Tormarancia is a colorful and bohemian one, immersed in a green environment, where you'll admire the graffiti and street art of Gaia, Van Helten, Mr. Klevra, Lek and Sowat, Clemens Behr and Seth Globepainter. Afterwards you'll head to my place, round the corner and savor Pasta Amatriciana or Gricia in a local family home. About your host, Daniele: "Walking around my city, I saw visitors who didn't know what to do, where to eat real Roman cuisine, which museums to see, which places to visit, etc. So I came up with the idea of ​​introducing a different Rome and started to find really special places and experiences."

name: An unusual dinner at the Roman Walls at the Parco delle Mura Latine
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

We are looking forward to hosting you in Rome, next to the gorgeous gates Porta Latina and San Sebastiano, in the heart of the city, just 400 meters from the Colosseum. We live in a “house of leaves”, a modern and comfortable apartment that can accommodate up to 8 seated guests, or more as a buffet. We are not serving you just a dinner: what we offer is our point of view on Rome and our aim is linking the most authentic and traditional food to literature, art, photography, fashion, style and, of course, wine of which we can offer you suggestions, connections and taste (also “mixology” where required). For our debut on Eathwith we suggest a very variate menu, everything waccompanied by fragrant bread from Ceccacci Bakery (different typology according to daily availability), Taralli from Puglia and Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Last but not least the final surprise: before dinner we are glad to welcome you by the Roman Wall for an aperitivo and some historical tips on the area where we live!

name: Tandem Skydive from 4000m over Rome
description:
Experience the art of flight just 17km from central Rome on this tandem skydive!

Freefall over one of the most iconic cities in Europe on this tandem skydive just a few kilometres from Rome! Head east from the city centre and drop from 4000m - experiencing up to 45 seconds of pure G-Force. Enjoy one of the most thrilling extreme sports in the world - all under the expert supervision of a jumpmaster! Get ready for the ride of your life...

Location
This activity is run and operated from a private airfield in Rome. The only skydive location in the city, it is situated just 17km (30-min drive) and can be reached 8 minutes from the subway station C line 'Monte Compatri-Pantano'.

Activity 
Meet your jumpmaster at the airfield for this tandem skydive in Rome. Starting off with an introduction to the activity and the kit you’ll be wearing, gear up with a flight suit and goggles before you head to the strip and board the aircraft. A short panoramic flight over Monte Compatri and the surrounding countryside, you’ll soar to an altitude of 12,000ft/4,000m where you’ll get the best views of the Alban Hills out of one window - and the outskirts of Rome from the other. Marvel at the landscape before you cut above the clouds and get ready for your big jump. Securely strapped to the tandem master, take a deep breath – it’s time to take the ultimate leap and freefall for up to 45 seconds at 200km/h! Before you know it, your jumpmaster will have opened the parachute and you’ll glide for another 4-8 minutes – offering you a chance to really take in the views as you glide back down to the airbase, performing a soft landing in a dedicated drop zone.

Conditions
This skydive activity uses a small private aircraft custom made for skydiving. Whilst spectators are not allowed to accompany you in the aircraft, they are free to watch from the airbase. Please dress appropriately in closed-toe shoes and comfortable clothing.

name: FARM TO TABLE DINNER - A TRIP THROUGH ITALY in TRASTEVERE
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

My home is your home! This culinary experience is a cultural and sensory “travel” to discover the rich regional cuisine from Italy. I’m committed to provide an authentic Italian slow meal in a fun and entertaining way. During this multi-hour affair, you will taste different flavours, understand what’s on your plate, appreciate the true taste of meal. My menus are expressions of my love for my roots my culinary family traditions and Italian life style. I also love support locals micro-farms and cook with traditional Italian fresh ingredients. The experience is chef’s table style with a full interaction with me and my team. About your host: won "the Best home restaurant in Rome" according to star chef celebrity Alessandro Borghese, Italian TV Show "4 Ristoranti"

name: Taste of Trastevere: Experience the Best Food Flavours of Rome
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Experience Rome like a local and immerse yourself in one of the city’s oldest and most vibrant neighborhoods on foot, guided by chef Anastasiya as she shares her secrets with you. As a food and wine expert, you can trust that Anastasiya will introduce you to a variety of the most mouth watering food across a range of eateries. This amazing food tour will take you from breakfast to lunch, whilst you taste your way through some of the best food that Rome has to offer!

name: Rome Street Food Tour
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

This Rome Street Food Tour will take you off the beaten track and introduce you to the love affair that Romans have with street food. As you walk through the city, you will pass the famous Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Campo dei Fiori and eat at historical boutiques and contemporary eateries. Get a taste of local pizza, cheese, wine and ice cream and finish everything off the way Italians do: with an espresso!

name: Roman family dinner near Piazza Navona
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Sit at the table with Stella, Family, Friends and Guests from all over the world. She prepares homemade Italian delights and have you explore the tastes of Rome. About your host, Stella: "My grandmother was the muse of my gastronomic life. She gave me the passion for food and the secrets of Roman and regional Italian cuisine, that I am proud to preserve. To consolidate my knowledge in gastronomy, I specialized in a famous cooking academy in Rome”.

name: Kids Pasta & Tiramisu Cooking Class with a View
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Join Fiamma and Debora at home on top of the Gianicolo hill with a stunning view up to Piazza Venezia. You will learn how to prepare 3 Italian homemade dishes: "farfalle" and "cavatelli" naturally colored pasta as well as a traditional tiramisu. On arrival, you will be greeted with delicious bruschetta before getting stuck in to the class. When everything is ready, you'll take a seat and enjoy your creations! It will be an afternoon of food and fun!

name: Seafood Cooking Class and 3-course Dinner in Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Get a taste of real Italian culture when visiting Rome! Learn how to make authentic Italian dishes and bring your skills back home... Your host, Sandra, will teach you about buying the best quality ingredients and guide you step by step throughout the class. In a fun and dynamic atmosphere, you will cook and then enjoy a 3 course dinner of fresh fish and seafood. Your meal will be served with local Italian wine.

name: Roman Affair: Secret Dinner Spot
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Take a seat at Sandra’s table for a delicious 4-course Italian meal: a combination of rich regional recipes served with wine and beer. The best taste of Italy! This intimate dining experience will give you the chance to get to know your host, chef Sandra, as she cooks up a magnificent feast for you to enjoy on her picturesque Roman terrace, right by the Vatican! Please note that as the meal is prepared with the freshest in-season ingredients bought from the local market, the menu may change according to the season.

name: Rome Gourmet Food Tour
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

This food tour through Travestere will take you down colorful alleys and to ancient, artisanal boutiques. With the help of a local food expert, you'll explore the beating heart of Italy and discover Rome's oldest and traditional recipes. At each stop you'll try something new, starting with an ‘aperitivo’: local cheeses and a glass of wine. Then comes the traditional must-haves such as Roman supplì, the white pizza, ‘porchetta’, and pasta with carbonara sauce. You'll play the “Gioco dell’Ova” (Eggs game) where you have to try gourmet dishes like caviar and oysters and finish the tour with a cone of the best artisanal gelato in the area!

name: Roman fish market tour and cooking class
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Let Andrea show you the history and beauty of Rome while you tour a local fish market. Then head back to his place for a fish cooking class and lunch. • At the market you'll select a fish to cook together, then Andrea will teach you how to cook it using traditional Italian recipes before sitting down to enjoy your meal together • Cocktails and wine are included • You can choose whether you want to go to the Testaccio, Trionfale, or Piazza Vittorio fish market • The cooking class takes place in a penthouse in the historical district of Testaccio • Communal food walk for 2 to 6 people • Andrea is an engineer About your host, Andrea: "I spent my whole life traveling around the world. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing good meals with them."

name: Professional Pizza Workshop in Rome With a Brilliant Italian Chef
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Learn to make authentic pizza from an authentic Italian chef! Join your brilliant host Sandra as she teaches you how to make rustic pizza from some of the most popular pizza making provinces in Italy. Sandra is an Italian chef who has lived and worked all over Italy and now wants to share her knowledge with you! In her beautiful home, you’ll learn to appreciate the differences between the flavors, the dough and toppings. You'll then enjoy a sit down 2-course meal, including your pizza, served with wine and beer. Sandra’s food will leave you wanting more and provide you with the skills to recreate everything at home!

name: Piazza Bologna
Pasta & Tiramisu Cooking Class with Lunch (10 am class)
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Fiamma and Debora in their beautiful appartment for a dynamic hands-on cooking class! You will start by preparing the tiramisu before making pasta from scratch (such as Fettuccine and Amatriciana sauce and Ravioli). Enjoy nibbles while you cook then sit down for lunch!

name: Italian Dinner with a Panoramic View
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Debora and her daughter Fiamma for a delightful Roman dinner at the top of the Gianicolo hill. The 3-course meal will be served with local wine and you'll dine on their beautiful balcony. Fiamma and Debora are wonderful and experienced hosts, always willing to share stories about their life in Rome and to teach you about Italian traditions, customs and the history behind each dish. This is the perfect experience to meet people as their table fits up to 25 guests!

name: An Evening Of Rooftop Roman Cocktails And Delicious Small Plates
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Phoebe invites you to her charming home in Rome with a stunning view of the city. Sip on refreshing, locally influenced cocktails that Phoebe has paired with delicious, homemade small plates. Enjoy the atmosphere of your surroundings and mingle with other guests in this intimate, open-air experience!

name: Make Pasta & Enjoy a 3-course dinner in Rome
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Join Sandra, your charismatic host, for a dynamic pasta making class! You will spend a couple of hours preparing, cooking, and learning how to make pasta . When everything is ready, you will take a seat at her dining table and enjoy your very own home-cooked Italian meal with a delicious glass of wine.

name: Wine Tasting: Wine, Food, and Caravaggio in Baroque Rome
description:
Take part in a fascinating wine tasting revolving around the art and history of Caravaggio and how it intertwines with Italian food and wine. 

Admire his paintings, sip wine, and enjoy traditional snacks in Rome. 

Meet in Piazza Navona, to then head to an exclusive, 1500 year old location dedicated to quality wine and food.

name: Twilight Local Food, History and Hidden Places
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Eat like a local and feel like a Roman on this unique evening adventure. Discover the historical center of Rome through more than 15 off-the-beaten-path food and wine tastings! • The many delicious stops include Cannolo, cheeses, salami, pizza 'al taglio' in an ancient bakery from 1880, followed by a sit-down dinner in a cozy restaurant with traditional bruschetta and the best Carbonara in town, cooked by a Michelin-starred chef • Start with a typical Roman 'aperitivo' in a historical bar owned by the same family for 150 years, and finish with a toast of a homemade limoncello, as well as wine tastings in between • Walk through the best hidden parts of Rome, including the Campo de Fiori and one of the most beautiful Roman fountains! • Communal food walk for up to 12 people • The tastings will be 'seasoned' with storytelling about Rome, its history and archeological secrets About your host, Selene: "I'm Selene, a Roman for generations and the co-founder of 'Roma Eat Food Experience'. We're archeologists, official guides, food and wine experts, but mostly, we're great friends. Our mantra is to be the people we would love to meet when traveling: passionate, positive, curious, and engaging!"

name: 4-course fish & seafood dinner in Monteverde
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Enjoy a fish dinner dinner in the beautiful neighborhood of Monteverde, where Massimo will share his love for Roman food with you. • 4-course seafood and fish dinner • Italian wines included • Massimo's home is in Monteverde Vecchio, just a few minutes from Trastevere and the historic center • Dinner for 4 to 12 people • Massimo has a wonderful sense of hospitality and a great love for Italian food About your host, Massimo: I want to share my passion for Italian and Roman cuisine with my guests. I'll host in my house in Monteverde Vecchio, just a few minutes away from the famous Trastevere neighborhood. We'll start our dinner with a glass of Prosecco and a lot of small-talk.

name: Become a Roman chef in a day
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

A visit to Rome is not complete without a ''hands-on'' cooking class with Chef Federico Alessandri! The lesson begins with a walking tour in the famous open market through Campo dei Fiori, where you will be guided by Chef Federico in learning how to choose the right seasonal ingredients. Then you will collaborate in creating the traditional menu that you will cook and enjoy. It's a short walk through the beautiful historic center to Federico's apartment which is in the heart of Trastevere (one of the oldest parts of Rome). It is here that you begin to become a ''Chef in a Day'' and the cooking adventure starts! You will be taught from scratch how to make 3 different fresh pastas from 2 different doughs ( a long pasta , a stuffed pasta and a short pasta), prepare a traditional second course of meat or fish with vegetables, and a delicious dessert. The lesson is ''hands-on'' and will take approximately 5 hrs. All the recipes will be explained in detail, and many tricks and tips will be given during the class. Chef Federico does not only teach recipes, he explains the ''why'' and ''how'' of the methods taught. You are welcome to join a fun-filled international open group or book a private lesson. As a previous participant once said, ''A class with Federico is an educational party''. A lot of fun and laughs are guaranteed! The class will end with the enjoyment of the lunch you prepared, accompanied by some good Italian wines. Without a doubt, this will be the highlight of your trip to Italy and you'll go back home with the same passion for cooking as Chef Federico Alessandri. So, become a ''Chef in a Day''!

name: Much more than a Cooking Class: Pasta and Tiramisu
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Join your hosts, Debora and Fiamma in their stunning home at the top of Gianicolo Hill for a wonderful evening making delicious pasta and tiramisu! You’ll start by making a traditional tiramisu, followed by pasta like fettuccine and ravioli, all from scratch! Enjoy nibbles whilst Debora and Fiamma teach you all the best techniques to make your meal, and then sit down and savour all your hard work.

name: Evening Walk around Trastevere
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Immerse yourself in Roman life as your host Anastasiya takes you on a street tour of Trastevere to discover a variety of local specialties and wines! You’ll be trying food from the best eateries in Rome, tasting everything from street food and cheeses to aperitivo and tiramisu. You will get a real taste of the city as you explore the narrow cobblestone streets and enjoy a sit down dinner in the coziest of settings. With wine included alongside your meal, this experience has everything covered so you can relax and enjoy your evening of Roman food!

name: New Year's Eve on a Roman Terrace
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Celebrate the New Year with Rocco and Fabio during this traditional Italian dinner! Discover their traditional family recipes at this dinner on their cozy Roman terrace. Choose your menu beforehand, then sit back and enjoy the beautiful setting!

name: Roman dinner party in a stylish apartment
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Experience traditional, organic Roman cuisine with a modern touch in a relaxed, friendly home. Best friends Giovanna and Cristina use family recipes and great wines to make you feel welcome! • 4-course tasting menu made with organic, local products • Wine and digestif are included • Communal dining for 4 to 10 people • Over 60 rave reviews on TripAdvisor About your host, Giovanna E Cristina: "We are Giovanna and Cristina, 2 best friends who love to share our passion for cooking. Inspired by traditional Italian recipes passed down by our families, we believe that simple, local food is the best food. Like many Italians, we know that a good meal is made better with wine!"

name: Restaurant L'Eau Vive
Roman Forum
Pizza day in the countryside
description:
Fulvia and her family live in a 1920s house in the Roman countryside with an amazing garden. Join them for an organic, homemade, typical Italian meal made with the vegetables picked directly from their garden.

Their house is away from the noise of the city; it's a place where you can relax and breath in the fresh country air. If you're looking for an authentic experience with an Italian family and to eat delicious wood oven pizza, then this experience is for you!
